Calculate Returns

Source: R/utils.R
calc_returns.Rd

Calculate simple or logarithmic returns from a price series.

Usage

calc_returns(prices, type = c("simple", "log"), lag = 1)

Arguments

prices

Numeric vector: price series

type

Character: "simple" or "log" (default: "simple")

lag

Integer: number of periods for return calculation (default: 1)

Value

Numeric vector of returns

Examples

prices <- c(100, 102, 101, 103, 105, 104, 106)

# Simple returns
calc_returns(prices, type = "simple")
#> [1]           NA  0.020000000 -0.009803922  0.019801980  0.019417476
#> [6] -0.009523810  0.019230769

# Log returns
calc_returns(prices, type = "log")
#> [1]           NA  0.019802627 -0.009852296  0.019608471  0.019231362
#> [6] -0.009569451  0.019048195

# Multi-period returns
calc_returns(prices, type = "simple", lag = 5)
#> [1]         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA 0.04000000 0.03921569
